e4: I recommend not changing to the new policy because it may create confusion among investors, particularly retail investors who may overreact to a perceived shift in earnings bias. This could lead to short-term market benefits followed by disappointment and losses when actual results fall short of revised expectations.
e5: An ethical reporting policy would be transparent, consistent, and unbiased. It would disclose any relevant information that could impact investors' decisions, such as accounting choices or estimates, rather than implied or unstated biases. The policy would also avoid creating confusion among investors by being clear and straightforward about financial performance. In addition, the policy should take into account the needs of diverse investor groups, including small and sophisticated investors, to ensure fair treatment and disclosure.
e6: Yes. I would ask the management team to provide more information on how they plan to communicate the change in policy to investors, particularly retail investors, and how they will ensure that all stakeholders are educated about the implications of the new policy.
